content: round you should have - 14 fptr & 28 treble_crochet round 4 this is the trickiest round so plenty of photos are provided as a visual guide and a lighter yarn has been used for the photo to highlight the stitches better the next steps are going to be worked between these 2 fptr stitches here work 1 fptr around the 1st fptr then 1tr into the 1st space then 1 fptr around the 1st treble_crochet notice we are not at the second fptr yet 5 work 1tr into the next space and that is the first block of stitches done you should have 1fptr 1tr 1fptr 1tr skip over the treble_crochet and repeat the sequence again starting with the next fptr repeat until you complete the round slip_stitch to join ch1 at the end of this round you should have 28 fptr & 28 treble_crochet notice the amount of fptr stitches has doubled since round 3 round 5 this is the final increasing round and it just needs an extra treble_crochet between each fptr so where there was one just 1tr there will now be 2tr work 1 fptr around the 1st fptr then 2tr in the space then 1 fptr around the next fptr and 2tr in the space repeat all the way around slip_stitch to join ch1 at the end of this round you should have 28 fptr & 56 treble_crochet 6 round 6 this round is where the back post treble_crochet bptr stitch is introduced the fptr will be worked as usual but a bptr will be worked around every treble_crochet again the photos show a lighter coloured yarn to highlight how the stitches should look begin with a fptr around the first fptr then a bptr around each of the treble_crochet repeat around slip_stitch to join ch1 at the end of this round you should have 28 fptr & 56 bptr round 7 round 34 repeat round 6 until your hat is desired length recommended 34 rounds the hat should slowly start to take shape at round 12 or 13 fasten_off sew in ends and attach pompom if required fold over the brim to the desired size 7 joining a new colour there are many ways to join new colours in crochet and it is fine to use whichever way you are comfortable with the method used in both of these patterns is very simple once you have joined your round with a slip_stitch instead of chaining 1 with your current colour put a loop on your hook with the new colour and pull through as if you were working a chain this counts as your ch1 then for extra security take the 2 loose ends and tie them in a knot you can see i have done here making the hat in different sizes if you wanted to make the hat for a child all you need to do is start with a smaller number of stitches in the initial round 6-18months work 11tr
